resources.string:
AVAILABLE: Indicates whether network connectivity is possible. A network is unavailable when a persistent or semi-persistent condition prevents the possibility of connecting to that network

FAILOVER: Indicates whether the current attempt to connect to the network resulted from the ConnectivityManager trying to fail over to this network following a disconnect from another network

ROAMING: Indicates whether the device is currently roaming on this network. When true, it suggests that use of data on this network may incur extra costs

TRUSTED: Indicates that the user has indicated implicit trust of this network. This generally means it\'s a sim-selected carrier, a plugged in ethernet, a paired BT device or a wifi the user asked to connect to. Untrusted networks are probably limited to unknown wifi AP. Set by default.\n\nVALIDATED: Indicates that connectivity on this network was successfully validated. For example, for a network with NET_CAPABILITY_INTERNET, it means that Internet connectivity was successfully detected.
